address.verbatim-address: Kosovo Agency of Statistics, 10000 Prishtina, Rruga Zenel Salihu 4

table-block-simple.endnote: Assessment of the Office of Statistics of the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia

Enumerated population, excluding data for municipalities of Leposaviq/Leposavić, Zubin Potok, Zveçan/Zvečan and Mitrovicë e Veriut/Severna Mitrovica (North Mitrovicë) where no census was conducted; a consolidated total census population of 1,780,021 (including estimates for these municipalities) was published in 2013

Excluding data for the (principally Serb-inhabited) municipalities of Leposaviq/Leposavić, Zubin Potok and Zveçan/Zvečan, and the northern districts of Mitrovicë/Mitrovica, where no census was conducted.
Including other groups, non-declared persons and those of unknown ethnicity
table-block-simple.content-note: Note: Classification of ethnic groups reflects national census methodology.

table-block-simple.endnote: The Serbian names are given after the Albanian names, where they differ.

Including Mitrovica e Veriut/Severna Mitrovica (North Mitrovicë), with an estimated population of
12,828. The remainder of the municipality was subsequently renamed Mitrovicë e Jugut/Južna Mitrovica (South Mitrovicë).

ss-entry-simple.ss-entry-data: 76.8 (males 74.2; females 79.6) in 2021 (Source: World Bank, World Development Indicators database)

table-block-simple.content-note: Note: Data exclude second crops and autumn crops; production from state-owned enterprises is also excluded.
Note: Data exclude livestock belonging to state-owned enterprises.
Note: Data exclude production by state-owned enterprises.
Note: Data exclude removals by state-owned enterprises.
Note: Figures include donor-designated grants and Privatization Agency of Kosovo (PAK) operations.
